intro: Wulffia macrocephala, commonly known as the giant white lily, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters, often reaching several inches in diameter. The plant has broad, lance-shaped leaves and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is valued for its ornamental beauty. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is relatively rare and not widely cultivated.
